body:
# github.cr
A GItHub API Wrapper for the Crystal programming language!

def.name: to_json
def.body:
json.object do
  _content = @content
  if _content.nil?
  else
    json.field("content") do
      _content.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _encoding = @encoding
  if _encoding.nil?
  else
    json.field("encoding") do
      _encoding.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _url = @url
  if _url.nil?
  else
    json.field("url") do
      _url.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _sha = @sha
  if _sha.nil?
  else
    json.field("sha") do
      _sha.to_json(json)
    end
  end
  _size = @size
  if _size.nil?
  else
    json.field("size") do
      _size.to_json(json)
    end
  end
end

types.name: Client
types.doc:
The basic class which represents a GitHub client / user
the client will be used to send REST requests to the GitHub
API.

```cr
client = GitHub::Client.new(username: "TheOnlyArtz", token: "4f10YOU8654d442b5be610054e9sWISH7a813c4")
```
With this client you will be able to make API requests to Discord
types.summary: The basic class which represents a GitHub client / user the client will be used to send REST requests to the GitHub API.

instance_methods.name: get_auth_header
instance_methods.doc: This method will generate the auth header to GitHub
instance_methods.summary: This method will generate the auth header to GitHub

types.name: REST
types.doc:
This module enables GitHub.cr to interact with the
GitHub API through HTTP requests
types.summary: This module enables GitHub.cr to interact with the GitHub API through HTTP requests

class_methods.name: raw_request
class_methods.doc: This function is responsible for requesting the API
class_methods.summary: This function is responsible for requesting the API
class_methods.args_string: (method : String, path : String, headers : HTTP::Headers, body : String?)

def.name: raw_request
def.body:
request_done = false
pp(API_BASE + path)
while !request_done
  GLOBAL_MUTEX.synchronize do
  end
  response = HTTP_CLIENT.exec(method: method, path: path, headers: headers, body: body)
  if (response.status_code == 429) || (response.headers["X-RateLimit-Remaining"]? == 0)
    retry_after_val = response.headers["X-RateLimit-Reset-After"]?
    retry_after = retry_after_val.not_nil!.to_f
    GLOBAL_MUTEX.synchronize do
      sleep(retry_after)
    end
    if response.status_code == 429
    else
      request_done = true
    end
  else
    request_done = true
  end
end
response.not_nil!

class_methods.name: request
class_methods.args_string: (method : String, path : String, headers : HTTP::Headers, body : String?)

def.name: request
def.body:
response = raw_request(method, path, headers, body)
if response.success?
else
  if response.content_type.not_nil!.includes?("application/json")
  else
    raise("Unknown/bad payload")
  end
  raise((MalformedMessage.from_json(response.body)).message)
end
response.body

types.name: Blobs
types.doc:
This module is specifically for interacting with
the Blobs endpoints GitHub offers us to use.
see [GitHub Gists endpoints](https://developer.github.com/v3/git/blobs/)
types.summary: This module is specifically for interacting with the Blobs endpoints GitHub offers us to use.

def.name: create_blob
def.body:
json = REST.request("POST", "/repos/#{owner}/#{repository}/git/blobs", HTTP::Headers {"Authorization" => get_auth_header}, payload.to_json)
pp(json)

instance_methods.name: get_blob
instance_methods.doc:
The content in the response will always be Base64 encoded.
NOTE: This API supports blobs up to 100 megabytes in size.
instance_methods.summary: The content in the response will always be Base64 encoded.
instance_methods.args_string: (owner : String, repository : String, file_sha : String) : Blob

def.name: get_blob
def.body:
json = REST.request("GET", "/repos/#{owner}/#{repository}/git/blobs/#{file_sha}", HTTP::Headers {"Authorization" => get_auth_header}, nil)
Blob.from_json(json)

types.doc:
This module is specifically for interacting with
the Blobs endpoints GitHub offers us to use.
see [GitHub Gists endpoints](https://developer.github.com/v3/git/commits/)
types.summary: This module is specifically for interacting with the Blobs endpoints GitHub offers us to use.

instance_methods.name: get_commit
instance_methods.args_string: (owner : String, repository : String, commit_sha : String) : Commit

def.name: get_commit
def.body:
json = REST.request("GET", "/repos/#{owner}/#{repository}/commits/#{commit_sha}", HTTP::Headers {"Authorization" => get_auth_header}, nil)
Commit.from_json(json)

types.name: Gists
types.doc:
This module is specifically for interacting with
the Gists endpoints GitHub offers us to use.
see [GitHub Gists endpoints](https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/)
types.summary: This module is specifically for interacting with the Gists endpoints GitHub offers us to use.

instance_methods.name: create_gist
instance_methods.summary: Creates a gist on the auth user's account.

def.name: create_gist
def.body:
json = REST.request("POST", "/gists", HTTP::Headers {"Authorization" => get_auth_header, "Content-Type" => "application/json"}, payload.to_json)
Gist.from_json(json)

instance_methods.name: delete_gist
instance_methods.doc: Allows you to delete a gist by it's ID
instance_methods.summary: Allows you to delete a gist by it's ID

instance_methods.name: fork_gist
instance_methods.doc: Allows you to fork a gist by it's ID
instance_methods.summary: Allows you to fork a gist by it's ID

def.name: fork_gist
def.body:
json = REST.request("POST", "/gists/#{id}/forks", HTTP::Headers {"Authorization" => get_auth_header}, nil)
Gist.from_json(json)

instance_methods.name: get_all_gists
instance_methods.doc:
NOTE: This will return the public repositories only
if it wasn't obvious already...
instance_methods.summary: NOTE This will return the public repositories only if it wasn't obvious already...

def.name: get_all_gists
def.body:
json = REST.request("GET", "/users/#{owner}/gists", HTTP::Headers {"Authorization" => get_auth_header}, nil)
Array(Gist).from_json(json)

instance_methods.name: get_gist
instance_methods.doc: Get a gist by it's ID

def.name: get_gist
def.body:
json = REST.request("GET", "/gists/#{id}", HTTP::Headers {"Authorization" => get_auth_header}, nil)
Gist.from_json(json)

instance_methods.name: get_gist_revision
instance_methods.doc: Get a revision of a gist by it's ID and sha
instance_methods.summary: Get a revision of a gist by it's ID and sha

def.name: get_gist_revision
def.body:
json = REST.request("GET", "/gists/#{id}/#{sha}", HTTP::Headers {"Authorization" => get_auth_header}, nil)
Gist.from_json(json)

instance_methods.name: get_public_gists
instance_methods.doc:
List public gists sorted by most recently updated to least recently updated.
NOTE: With pagination, you can fetch up to 3000 gists. For example
you can fetch 100 pages with 30 gists per page or 30 pages with 100 gists per page.

```cr
gists = client.get_public_gists(
   Time.local(2018, 3, 8, 22, 5, 13, location: Time::Location.load("Europe/Berlin"))
)
```
instance_methods.summary: List public gists sorted by most recently updated to least recently updated.

def.name: get_public_gists
def.body:
params = HTTP::Params.encode({"since" => (URI.parse(since.to_s)).to_s})
json = REST.request("GET", "/gists/public?#{params}", HTTP::Headers {"Authorization" => get_auth_header}, nil)
Array(Gist).from_json(json)

instance_methods.name: get_starred_gists
instance_methods.doc:
List the auth user's starred gists
TODO check if since can be null
instance_methods.summary: List the auth user's starred gists TODO check if since can be null

def.name: get_starred_gists
def.body:
params = HTTP::Params.encode({"since" => (URI.parse(since.to_s)).to_s})
json = REST.request("GET", "/gists/starred?#{params}", HTTP::Headers {"Authorization" => get_auth_header}, nil)
Array(Gist).from_json(json)

instance_methods.name: gist_starred?
instance_methods.doc: Allows you to check whether a gist is starred
instance_methods.summary: Allows you to check whether a gist is starred

def.name: gist_starred?
def.body:
response = REST.request("GET", "/gists/#{id}/star", HTTP::Headers {"Authorization" => get_auth_header}, nil)
true

instance_methods.name: list_gist_commits
instance_methods.doc: Allows you to list the commits of a gist by it's ID
instance_methods.summary: Allows you to list the commits of a gist by it's ID

def.name: list_gist_commits
def.body:
json = REST.request("GET", "/gists/#{id}/commits", HTTP::Headers {"Authorization" => get_auth_header}, nil)
Array(GistCommit).from_json(json)

instance_methods.name: star_gist
instance_methods.doc: Allows you star a gist by it's ID
instance_methods.summary: Allows you star a gist by it's ID

instance_methods.name: unstar_gist
instance_methods.doc: Allows you to unstar a gist by it's ID
instance_methods.summary: Allows you to unstar a gist by it's ID

instance_methods.name: update_gist
instance_methods.doc:
Allows you to update or delete a gist file and rename gist files
Files from the previous version of the gist that aren't
explicitly changed during an edit are unchanged.
TODO: Look into the different [new fields](https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/#update-a-gist)
that might appear
instance_methods.summary: Allows you to update or delete a gist file and rename gist files Files from the previous version of the gist that aren't explicitly changed during an edit are unchanged.

def.name: update_gist
def.body:
json = REST.request("PATCH", "/gists/#{id}", HTTP::Headers {"Authorization" => get_auth_header, "Content-Type" => "application/json"}, payload.to_json)
Gist.from_json(json)

def.name: to_json
def.body:

  if _sha.nil?
  else
    json.field("sha") do

    end
  end
end
